Text.Value: Warm to the guile of a bard who could charm even a dragon.
Gaze into the mirror, intent on offering it one of your memories.
Offer a prayer to the mirror.
*The gaps in your mind grow wider as you allow yourself to be diminished.*

EditorData.VFXTags: [DP] Mirror connects with player and steals a memory, beam or light or something like this

Text.Value: *The cold bites, but you laugh and bare your chest. Be it blade, beast, or the elements - nothing daunts you.*
*Your mind still reels from what you have already received from the mirror. You cannot partake again.*
*You devoured any book you could get your hands on, hungry for more. Sometimes you felt like you read the same thing over and over, yet the knowledge within always seemed new...*
Seize the memories of a barbarian, whose mind and body were tempered against hardship.
*You are helpless as it explores your very being. It knows the secrets of your violent heart.*
*The deception fails. You feel that something true to you is wrested from you as punishment, with nothing given in return.*
*The huge mirror stares down at you like a great, dark eye.*

EditorData.VFXTags: [DP] Mirror glowing, connecting with Player + Hypnotising them

Text.Value: *You are helpless as it explores your very being. It knows the secrets of your jealous heart.*
*A great, dark mirror looms over you, offering no reflection. You do not know its purpose... yet it feels oddly familiar to you, all the same.*

EditorData.VFXTags: [DP] Mirror glowing, connecting with Player + Hypnotising them

Text.Value: Seize the fortitude that lies in a heart denied a thousand times.
*Something precious was surrendered. Already, you cannot recall its exact nature - but you feel its loss, all the same.*

EditorData.VFXTags: [DP] Mirror connects with player and steals a memory, beam or light or something like this

Text.Value: *Great powers rest within the realm of the mirror, to be granted at the Dark Lady's whim to those making a suitable offering - a piece of themselves.*
*Now, all you need to do is claim a reward.*
*Your deception fails. You sense the mirror would snatch something true from you, but you have nothing it desires.*
*You are helpless as it explores your very being. It knows the secrets of your yearning heart.*
*Where once the mirror showed nothing, there is now something. Memories, experiences, skills. All prised from the minds of others, and now offered to you, to choose from.*
*Adoring looks, fawning laughter and nods of agreement are your constant companions. Is there anything a quick tongue and a warm smile cannot achieve...?*
*You feel parts of your own being take flight from you. Is this what Shadowheart experienced, when she surrendered her memories...?*

EditorData.VFXTags: [DP] Mirror connects with player and steals a memory, beam or light or something like this

Text.Value: *A huge, polished disc looms before you. A mirror - one used by the Sharrans to plunder memories from the minds of others.*

EditorData.VFXTags: [DP] Mirror glowing, connecting with Player + Hypnotising them

Text.Value: Adopt the curiosity of a young child who hungered for knowledge forbidden to her.
Give away memories of when your charm stood to you - the applause of the swayed, the smiles of the beguiled, the kisses of the seduced.
*You embody Arves, the merchant you met, deep in mourning. His wife died, and he cannot bear to go on. Only the House of Grief can help him.*
*Nothing comes to you. The mirror remains a mystery.*
Steal the deft-handed prowess of someone trained in steath all her life.
*You embody an officer of the City Watch. A comrade died because of you. The dead man's face fades away... but the identities of informants vanish as well.*
*The spilled blood of Sel√ªne's daughter comes to your mind. You are a favoured servant. A Dark Justiciar.*
Absorb the wisdom of a novice who weathered harsh lessons and harsher punishments.
Glean the secrets of a wizard who once stalked the library of Candlekeep.
*You are helpless as it explores your very being. It knows the secrets of your prying heart.*
You learned much from Allister Marnley, your old teacher. Now part with his lessons.
Relinquish memories of fortitude and well-being, when body and mind held fast against all challenges.
Give up memories of your youth, when your heart was carefree and your limbs were nimble.
Part with the forbidden knowledge from the Thayan Tome.
*Incredibly, false thoughts of loyalty to Shar pass muster, and are ushered out of your mind.*
*Somehow, false memories of contrition and penance to Shar are accepted as true, and vanish from your mind.*
*False memories of a grand festival in the Moonmaiden's honour are accepted with a distinct note of scorn.*
*False memories of an imagined battle in the Astral Plane are accepted, and taken from your mind.*
*To your surprise, the false memory is accepted. It fades from your mind as easily as it was conjured forth.*
*A huge, polished disc looms before you. A mirror - but one that offers no reflection. All you see in it is a void of endless darkness.*

EditorData.VFXTags: [DP] Mirror glowing, connecting with Player + Hypnotising them

Text.Value: *The Mother Superior shook her head. You were not yet ready. But you would persist. You would try harder. One day, you would become a Dark Justiciar.*
Embrace the cunning of a youth who learned to succeed through charm and deceipt.
*Where once the mirror showed nothing, there is now something. Memories, experiences, skills - your own. Surrendered once, and now offered back to you to choose from.*
*A foreign sensation assails you. For a moment, you do not feel like yourself.*

EditorData.VFXTags: [DP] Mirror glows brighter as it implants new memory in player

Text.Value: *A Mirror of Loss - a relic said to be as old as the Church of Shar itself. Those who stood before it could surrender their very thoughts and memories to the Lady of Loss.*
*Words and symbols flurry past. Years of reading by candlelight dulled your eyesight, but sharpened your mind. Your knowledge lights up even the murkiest of mysteries.*
*You feel your goddess' presence once again. As her Chosen, you have already made the ultimate offering.*
*The memory fades away, yet it leaves its mark on your mind.*
Study the mirror. Try to grasp its true nature.
*A small miracle - the Mother Superior believed your lie. Or does she...? There is a bright gleam in her eye. Appreciation, perhaps? Respect?*
*On either side, your ranks start to buckle under the enemy onslaught. You unleash a battle cry and push back, rallying the troops.*
*First you took apples from stalls, then gold from purses. Once, you even lifted a necklace right off a matron's throat. The other novices were in awe of you.*

RollAdvantageReason.Value: You underwent the Mapping of the Heart

Text.Value: Offer a prayer to the mirror.
*Whatever power lurks deeper in the recesses of the mirror has no interest in you.*
Help yourself to the memories of a seasoned thief's most daring exploits.
*You feel the presence of something, ancient and unknowable. It has taken notice of you.*

EditorData.VFXTags: [DP] Mirror glows brighter as it implants new memory in player

Text.Value: *It seems to be intrigued by you.*
*Day after day, the bullies would await you. But you would not give in. Whatever they did, you would return in kind, blow for blow. Your knuckles ached. Your lip bled. But you stood tall.*
An object of faith. Examine it closely. Try to understand its purpose.
*A huge, polished disc looms before you. A mirror - one that was used to wrest your memories from you.*

EditorData.VFXTags: [DP] Mirror glowing, connecting with Player + Hypnotising them

Text.Value: *You escape across the rooftops of Baldur's Gate with the sure-footedness of a cat. The jingle of stolen gold and the fading cries of the City Watch are music to your ears.*
*The mirror's emptiness seems to draw your into a stupefying embrace. Your thoughts, feelings, memories - they grow slow and drowsy, drifting away from each other.*

EditorData.VFXTags: [DP], Mirror VFX Spiralling to hypnotise the player, Vignette grows from the edge of the screen, isolating the player from their companions/surroundings

Text.Value: This feels familiar to me, somehow. I'm sure I've stood before this mirror before... many times, perhaps.

EditorData.NodeContext: Unsettled sense of recognition/hairs standing on the back of your neck. (this mirror is what was used to take Shadowheart's memories from her)

Text.Value: *A jumble of memories clamour for your attention. They range from ancient to new. But none are yours.*
You fled the city watch once, leaving graffiti in your wake. Let go of that memory of youthful speed and nimbleness.
*You are helpless as it explores your very being. It knows the secrets of your false heart.*
*You embody a merchant, deep in mourning. His wife died, and he cannot bear to go on. Only the House of Grief can help him.*
*You are helpless as it explores your very being. It knows the secrets of your craven heart.*
Claim memories of strength from a long-dead general, who marched under the banner of a vanished kingdom.
Leave.
Offer a prayer to the mirror.
*Your mind is that of corrupt alderman, eager to forget his transgressions. You feel them fade away... but your faith in the goddess Sel√ªne is devoured along with them.*
Turn to the wisdom of a drow. Once of Lothe, then of Shar.
*The mirror has already leached away all it desires from you. Your mind is but an empty cup.*
Part with memories of blooming romance, when your heart was full and smile came readily.
*You embody a heartbroken heiress, desperate to forget an unrequited love. The sadness flees from you... along with a string of numbers. A safe combination?*
Your little hideaway in the cloister. It helped you weather life's blows. Give up that sense of solace.
Offer memories of your strength - times when you triumphed, thanks to your raw power.
*The sting of the rod washes over you, again and again. Like some cruel, endless tide. But you shall not cry out, or let tears bead your eyes. You shall persevere.*
*Still though, for whatever was lost, something new shall be gained...*
Let go off some wisdoms that time has bestowed upon you - old wounds, tough lessons and, fond memories alike.
Claim the strength found in a spirit who has had to fight for her place in the world.
You will not surrender any part of yourself. Invent a false offering to trick the mirror.
*With so much of your mind already surrendered to the mirror, you have nothin to offer. A sorry outcome.*
*The dark mirror seems to turn dormant, its hunger sated.*
*Your prayers fade away into the nothingness of the mirror, unacknowledged.*
*You must surrender some part of yourself. But what?*
Offer a prayer to the mirror.
Rediscovering your long-lost friend bolstered your very being - surrender that feeling.
*You feel a presence; dark and ancient. It approves of your fealty.*
*Disappointment floods your mind. You were sure to succeed Stelmane, but Lord Enver Gortash has stolen your support. All that charming and cajoling in the parlours of the Upper City, wasted.*
*The memory fades away, yet you feel its influence linger in your body.*
Surrender valued knowledge gleaned from books, scrolls, tablets... words that left a mark on your mind - but no more.
*Experience fills you - a lifetime in service of darkenss. Yet, most curious - there is light there also. Adventures, long past. Friends and companions, remembered with a secret fondness.*

Synopsis: Covers the interactions with the mirror of loss in the Darkmoon Cloister. Allows players to offer memories in return for a chance to roll on a chance to be given stat improving memories.
